main event: On April 20, 1958, in Burlington, Iowa, approximately 94 people reported a fiery object going horizontally to the horizon.
interesting points: The object left a fiery trail and disappeared from sight in the same manner as it was sighted.
The observation lasted for 4 to 5 seconds with ground visual confirmation.
This event was reported to the radio station KBUR in Burlington, IA.
There are no photographs of the sighting.
The conclusion of the report suggested that the object was possibly a balloon, with insufficient data for evaluation.
